018package org.tquadrat.foundation.ap;
019
020import static java.lang.reflect.Proxy.isProxyClass;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.EMPTY_STRING;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.DebugOutput.ifDebug;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
026
027import javax.annotation.processing.Messager;
028import javax.annotation.processing.ProcessingEnvironment;
029import javax.lang.model.element.AnnotationMirror;
030import javax.lang.model.element.AnnotationValue;
031import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
032import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
033import javax.lang.model.element.Name;
034import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
035import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
036import javax.tools.Diagnostic;
037import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
038import java.util.List;
039import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
040import java.util.Optional;
041import java.util.Set;
042import java.util.StringJoiner;
043
044import org.apiguardian.api.API;
045import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
046
047/**
048 *  The specification for a set of helpers for annotation processing.
049 *
050 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
051 *  @version $Id: APHelper.java 1002 2022-02-01 21:33:00Z tquadrat $
052 *  @since 0.1.0
053 *
054 *  @UMLGraph.link
055 */
056@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: APHelper.java 1002 2022-02-01 21:33:00Z tquadrat $" )
057@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
058public interface APHelper extends Messager, ProcessingEnvironment
059{
060        /*---------*\
061    ====** Methods **==========================================================
062        \*---------*/
063    /**
064     *  <p>{@summary Returns the flag that indicates whether some debug
065     *  information should be emitted to the generated code.}</p>
066     *  <p>The value is controlled by the value of the annotation processor
067     *  option
068     *  {@value APBase#ADD_DEBUG_OUTPUT}.</p>
069     *
070     *  @return {@code true} if the debug information should be added,
071     *      {@code false} if not.
072     */
073    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
074    public boolean addDebugOutput();
075
076    /**
077     *  Retrieves the
078     *  {@link AnnotationMirror}
079     *  for the given annotation
080     *  from the given
081     *  {@link Element}
082     *  instance. Only declared annotations are considered, not the inherited
083     *  ones.
084     *
085     *  @param  element The element.
086     *  @param  annotationClass The annotation to look for.
087     *  @return An instance of
088     *      {@link Optional}
089     *      that holds the found {@code AnnotationMirror} instance.
090     *
091     *  @see Element#getAnnotationMirrors()
092     */
093    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationMirror> getAnnotationMirror( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass )
094    {
095        final var isProxyClass = isProxyClass( requireNonNullArgument( annotationClass, "annotationClass" ) );
096        ifDebug( a -> "annotationClass = %s".formatted( ((Class<?>) a [0]).getName() ), annotationClass );
097        final String annotationClassName;
098        if( isProxyClass )
099        {
100            final var interfaces = annotationClass.getInterfaces();
101            ifDebug( interfaces.length > 1, i ->
102            {
103                final var joiner = new StringJoiner( ", ", "annotation interface: ", EMPTY_STRING );
104                //noinspection SuspiciousArrayCast
105                for( final var c : ((Class<?> []) i) )
106                {
107                    joiner.add( c.getName() );
108                }
109                return joiner.toString();
110            }, (Object []) interfaces );
111            if( interfaces.length != 1 )
112                throw new AnnotationProcessingError( format( "annotationClass proxy '%s' implements more than one interface" ) );
113            annotationClassName = interfaces [0].getName();
114        }
115        else
116        {
117            annotationClassName = requireNonNullArgument( annotationClass, "annotationClass" ).getName();
118        }
119        ifDebug( "effective annotationClassName = %s"::formatted, annotationClassName );
120        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getAnnotationMirrors().stream()
121            .filter( m -> m.getAnnotationType().toString().equals( annotationClassName ) )
122            .findFirst();
123        ifDebug( retValue.isEmpty(), e ->
124        {
125            final var joiner = new StringJoiner( ", ", "annotationMirrors: ", EMPTY_STRING );
126            for( final var mirror : ((Element) e [0]).getAnnotationMirrors() )
127            {
128                joiner.add( mirror.getAnnotationType().toString() );
129            }
130            return joiner.toString();
131        }, element );
132
133        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
134        return retValue;
135    }   //  getAnnotationMirror()
136
137    /**
138     *  Retrieves the annotation value from the given annotation mirror.
139     *
140     *  @param  annotationMirror    The annotation mirror.
141     *  @return An instance of
142     *      {@link Optional}
143     *      that holds the found annotation value.
144     */
145    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationValue> getAnnotationValue( final AnnotationMirror annotationMirror )
146    {
147        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, "value" );
148
149        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
150        return retValue;
151    }   //  getAnnotationValue()
152
153    /**
154     *  Retrieves the annotation value with the given name from the given
155     *  annotation mirror.
156     *
157     *  @param  annotationMirror    The annotation mirror.
158     *  @param  name    The name of the desired value.
159     *  @return An instance of
160     *      {@link Optional}
161     *      that holds the found annotation value.
162     */
163    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationValue> getAnnotationValue( final AnnotationMirror annotationMirror, final String name )
164    {
165        final var elementValues = getElementUtils().getElementValuesWithDefaults( annotationMirror );
166        @SuppressWarnings( "unlikely-arg-type" )
167        final var retValue = elementValues.keySet().stream()
168            .filter( k -> k.getSimpleName().toString().equals( name ) )
169            .map( elementValues::get )
170            .findAny();
171
172        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
173        return retValue;
174    }   //  getAnnotationValue()
175
176    /**
177     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves a
178     *  {@link TypeMirror}
179     *  instance from an annotation.}</p>
180     *  <p>In case an annotation defines a
181     *  {@link Class Class&lt;?&gt;}
182     *  attribute, the value for that attribute is either {@code null} or
183     *  something strange, but never an instance of {@code Class<?>}. So
184     *  we need some special code to get something useful from the
185     *  annotation.</p>
186     *  <p>This implementations assumes the default name
187     *  &quot;<code>value</code>&quot; for the attribute.</p>
188     *
189     *  @param  element The annotated element.
190     *  @param  annotationClass The type of the annotation.
191     *  @return An instance of
192     *      {@link Optional}
193     *      that holds the {@code TypeMirror}
194     *      instance.
195     *  @throws NoSuchElementException  The given element is not annotated with
196     *      an annotation of the given type.
197     */
198    public default Optional<TypeMirror> getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass )
199    {
200        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( element, annotationClass )
201            .orElseThrow( () -> new NoSuchElementException( annotationClass.getName() ) );
202
203        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror )
204            .map( annotationValue -> (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
205
206        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
207        return retValue;
208    }   //  getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue()
209
210    /**
211     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves a
212     *  {@link TypeMirror}
213     *  instance from an annotation.}</p>
214     *  <p>In case an annotation defines a
215     *  {@link Class Class&lt;?&gt;}
216     *  attribute, the value for that attribute is either {@code null} or
217     *  something strange, but never an instance of {@code Class<?>}. So we
218     *  need some special code to get something useful from the annotation.</p>
219     *
220     *  @param  element The annotated element.
221     *  @param  annotationClass The type of the annotation.
222     *  @param  attributeName   The name of the attribute that holds the class.
223     *  @return An instance of
224     *      {@link Optional}
225     *      that holds the {@code TypeMirror}
226     *      instance.
227     *  @throws NoSuchElementException  The given element is not annotated with
228     *      an annotation of the given type.
229     */
230    public default Optional<TypeMirror> getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass, final String attributeName )
231    {
232        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( element, annotationClass )
233            .orElseThrow( () -> new NoSuchElementException( annotationClass.getName() ) );
234
235        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, attributeName )
236            .map( annotationValue -> (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
237
238        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
239        return retValue;
240    }   //  getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue()
241
242    /**
243     *  Checks whether the given element has the given annotation.
244     *
245     *  @note If the retention for the given annotation is not
246     *      {@link java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy#RUNTIME RUNTIME}
247     *      it could have been removed from the element in an earlier compile
248     *      run.
249     *
250     *  @param  <A> The type of the annotation.
251     *  @param  element The element to inspect.
252     *  @param  annotationType  The type of the annotation to look for.
253     *  @return {@code true} if the element is annotated with the given
254     *      annotation, {@code false} if not.
255     *
256     *  @see java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy#RUNTIME
257     */
258    public default <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation( final Element element, final Class<A> annotationType )
259    {
260        final var annotation = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getAnnotation( requireNonNullArgument( annotationType, "annotationType" ) );
261        final var retValue = annotation != null;
262
263        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
264        return retValue;
265    }   //  hasAnnotation()
266
267    /**
268     *  Determines whether the given instance of
269     *  {@link TypeMirror}
270     *  is for an
271     *  {@link Enum}
272     *  type.
273     *
274     *  @param  type    The type to check.
275     *  @return {@code true} if the given type is an {@code Enum} type,
276     *      {@code false} otherwise.
277     */
278    public boolean isEnumType( final TypeMirror type );
279
280    /**
281     *  {@inheritDoc}
282     */
283    @Override
284    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg )
285    {
286        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg );
287    }   //  printMessage()
288
289    /**
290     *  {@inheritDoc}
291     */
292    @Override
293    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element )
294    {
295        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element );
296    }   //  printMessage()
297
298    /**
299     *  {@inheritDoc}
300     */
301    @Override
302    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element, final AnnotationMirror annotation )
303    {
304        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element, annotation );
305    }   //  printMessage()
306
307    /**
308     *  {@inheritDoc}
309     */
310    @Override
311    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element, final AnnotationMirror annotation, final AnnotationValue value )
312    {
313        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element, annotation, value );
314    }   //  printMessage()
315
316    /**
317     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the names of a method's arguments.}</p>
318     *  <p>This method will return the names of the arguments as defined only
319     *  if the compiler flag {@code -parameters} is set; otherwise, the
320     *  arguments are just counted ({@code arg0}, {@code arg1}, {@code arg2},
321     *  …).</p>
322     *
323     *  @param  method  The method.
324     *  @return The names of the arguments.
325     */
326    public List<Name> retrieveArgumentNames( final ExecutableElement method );
327
328    /**
329     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the generic types for the given type.}</p>
330     *
331     *  @param  type    The
332     *      {@link TypeMirror} instance to inspect.
333     *  @return The type arguments the given type was defined with; will be the
334     *      empty list if that type was not generic.
335     */
336    public List<? extends TypeMirror> retrieveGenericTypes( final TypeMirror type );
337
338    /**
339     *  Retrieves the interfaces are that implemented or extended by the given
340     *  type element.
341     *
342     *  @param  typeElement The type element to inspect.
343     *  @param  interfaces  The already retrieved interfaces.
344     */
345    public default void retrieveInterfaces( final TypeElement typeElement, final Set<? super TypeElement> interfaces )
346    {
347        interfaces.add( typeElement );
348
349        for( final var typeMirror : typeElement.getInterfaces() )
350        {
351            final var nextInterface = (TypeElement) getTypeUtils().asElement( typeMirror );
352            if( !interfaces.contains( nextInterface ) )
353            {
354                retrieveInterfaces( nextInterface, interfaces );
355            }
356        }
357    }   //  retrieveInterfaces()
358}
359//  class APHelper
360
361/*
362 *  End of File
363 */
